fullText: Reimagining Sufjan Stevens’s 2005 album Illinois into a tale of love, longing, zombies, and killer clowns, when Illinoise works, it works like gangbusters. And when it doesn’t, fear not; there’s still plenty of beauty to behold at the St. James Theatre.

keyPhrases.quote: when Illinoise works, it works like gangbusters
And when it doesn't, fear not; there's still plenty of beauty to behold
there’s still plenty of beauty to behold

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic acknowledges the show has inconsistent moments but emphasizes that even when it falters, there's still significant artistic merit worth experiencing. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses a clear positive sentiment overall, highlighting both strengths and weaknesses without strong reservations.
